textList.name: TEXT_START_SCRAPPER
textList.text: Welcome to Scrapper space. The scrappers are elusive and don't make a habit of sharing information about their societies among travelers. They simply need scrap.

The Scrappers focus on acquiring scrap suggests that they prioritize resource acquisition above all else. Their societies are likely centered around scavenging, with social structures, customs, and hierarchies emerging from the need to efficiently collect and utilize resources. Cooperation and sharing of knowledge among Scrappers might occur within their own communities but may not extend readily to outsiders.

Scrappers seem to have a strong sense of self-reliance and resourcefulness, as they must navigate dangerous and unpredictable environments to find valuable scraps. They possess specialized knowledge about identifying and extracting useful materials from various sources, especially wrecked spacecraft and technological remnants.

event.text: The Scrappers seem to be far too pre-occupied with their persual of all things Scrap to post a guard at this beacon.

It would appear that the Scrappers bothered to post a guard at this beacon. They are not hostile, nor are they readying weapons and indeed after a few moments of silence, they hail you. CAPTAIN! SURELY YOU WILL UNDERSTAND! A TOLL MUST BE COLLECTED! TRANSFER SCRAP OR NO ENTRY!
You alert your crew of defensive positions as the Guard powers up their weapons.
You peacefully transfer the scrap to the scrapper, allowing you entrance to the Scrappers Space.

choice.text: (Scrapper Crew) Your Scrapper insists on speaking to the Guard.

event.text: Unsure if this is a good idea, but trustful of your crew, you allow them to approach the comm. They animatedely shout at the guard, and with a few moments it seems that insults are being thrown. Insulted, the guard powers up weapons and begins to attack!

choice.text: (Trash Eater) The Trash Eater insists on speaking to the Guard.

event.text: The Trash Eater walks up to the Comm and announces his presence onboard the ship. The guard seems to be concerned, alarmed, and even frightened. The Trash Eater insists that they pay him for the right to guard the space and to allow us passage. They i agree, transfering supplies to your ship. The Trash Eater, pleased with himself, enjoys some of the scrap for himself.

event.name: GUARD_SCRAPPER_DESTROY
event.text: You have destroyed the Scrapper vessel. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_SCRAPPER_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Scrapper. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_SCRAPPER_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Scrapper Guard, you've most certainly made your precenense in this sector known They probably won't be so pleased with you after this.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_SCRAPPER
event.text: You warp in to find a rather strong looking Scrapper. They hail you, "YOU KILLED OUR GUARD!! WE WILL KILL YOU!!"

event.name: SCRAPPER_NON_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE_REBEL
event.text: You warp in to find a rebel ship waiting at the beacon for any of those foolish to warp to zero! It looks like thats you.

event.name: SCRAPPER_NON_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE_DESTROY
event.text: It would seem you are not the only visitor to Scrapper space. The foreign ship explodes, leaving behind a field of salvage for you to collect.

event.name: SCRAPPER_NON_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE_DEADCREW
event.text: It would seem you are not the only visitor to Scrapper space. The vessel lies empty, giving you plenty of time to salvage it.

event.name: SCRAPPER_BOARDED_SCRAPPER
event.text: You warp in to find a damaged Scrapper ship being boarded by a Mantis vessel.

choice.text: Attack the Mantis in an attempt to save the Scrapper!

event.text: This isn't your problem.

event.name: MANTIS_SCRAPPER_BOARDED_DESTROY
event.text: The Mantis ship has been destroyed, allowing you to salvage it and rescuing the assaulted Scrapper ship, who is hailing you.
"THANK YOU! YOU IMPRESS US! AMARA WISHES TO JOIN YOU!"
"THANK YOU AGAIN FOR THE RESCUE!!"

event.name: MANTIS_SCRAPPER_BOARDED_DEADCREW
event.text: The Mantis ship lies empty, allowing you to salvage it and rescuing the assaulted Scrapper ship, who is hailing you.
"THANK YOU! YOU IMPRESS US! AMARA WISHES TO JOIN YOU!"
"THANK YOU AGAIN FOR THE RESCUE!!"

textList.name: TEXT_SCRAPPER_HOSTILE
textList.text: A Scrapper vessel is in this sector salvaging the beacon. As soon as it notices you it powers up its weapons!
You warp in to find a scrapper vessel just as it finishes salvaging a wrecked ship; without warning it moves in to attack!
Some groups of Scrappers are very defensive of their territory and it seems as if you've impeded on this ones turf!
You enter the system and find an unusually aggressive Scrapper military vessel has locked onto your ship and is readying its weapons!
You find a Scrapper vessel closely orbiting the beacon, likely waiting for easy victims like you!

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_SCRAPPER
textList.text: The Scrapper Ship breaks to pieces and you scrap whatever you can.
The Scrapper ship is no more. You scrap what you can.
The Scrappers are silent and their ship is in pieces, you scrap what remains.
The Scrapper wreckage lies scattered and smouldering. You salvage whatever fragments hold value.
Your crew salvages any usable remnants that remain from the the shattered Scrapper vessel.

textList.name: TEXT_DEADCREW_SCRAPPER
textList.text: The ship halls, now bloodied, are empty and silent. You take your time as you pick through the vessel.
The Scrappers put up a very tough fight but you are tougher.
The Scrappers have been killed Your crew strips the remainder of the Scrapper ship.
With the Scrappers defeated, your crew efficiently dismantles the remaining parts of their ship.
The lifeless bodies of the Scrappers mark their demise as your crew meticulously salvages the remaining Scrapper vessel.

You have warped in to find an Elite Scrapper vessel. It seems to simply dislike you as it powers up its weapons to engage.

textList.name: AUTO_SCRAPPER_FIGHT
textList.text: The Scrappers love to hunt these Rebel Auto-Ships; it seems you and them have something in common.
The beacon flashes silently and the space seems clear, until an Auto-Ship makes itself known and readies weapons!
You warp in to the beacon only to be greeted by an Auto-Ship!
The Rebels and their massive fleet of Auto-Ships disgust you as you ready yourself for battle.

The Scrappers like to destroy Auto-Ships to salvage any valuable component they offer, they've even been known to hunt them in groups! The Auto-Ships still come around this space though, regardless of how many the Scrappers tear apart. Here's one now!

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_SHOP
event.text: A scrapper vessel is in this sector. It's broadcasting a signal simply asking for scrap. Perhaps they mean to trade?
"EXCUSE ME?!? WE WILL STRIP THE SCRAP FROM YOUR BLOATED CARCASS!" It seems an advanced boarding party has entered your ship. Maybe they had a super shield bypass?

choice.text: Hail them and see if they would like to trade.

event.text: "WE NEED SCRAP!"

choice.text: Your scrapper waves his hands and sends a signal to the scrapper ship; "COUPON CODE!!!" He types in a short code and you notice the store prices drop!

textList.name: TEXT_SCRAPPER_OUTPOST
textList.text: A Scrapper Outpost has been constructed in this sector. A steady flow of activity is coming and going from the station, however, no signals are being publically broadcast, indicating this to be a research or military facility.

Within this sector lies a formidable Scrapper Outpost. The constant flurry of activity hints at the outpost's significance, yet the absence of any public broadcasts raises intriguing questions about its true purpose, possibly pointing towards secretive research endeavors or covert military operations.

The beacon transmitting the location of the facility is a mystery. The Scrapper Outpost in this region is not boardcasting public signals on it's own, yet it would seem that they are inviting ships in with the beacon transmitting a signal.

Amidst this sector, an imposing Scrapper Outpost commands attention, its presence marked by a continuous ebb and flow of activity. The absence of public broadcasts veils the outpost's true nature, leaving room for speculation.
A formidable Scrapper Outpost has taken root in this sector. Could it serve as a covert hub for cutting-edge research or as a strategic military stronghold, concealed from prying eyes?

event.text: It's better to shoot first and ask questions later.
Assuming this is a military facility, it would be heavily armed and very difficult to breach. It would be better to avoid conflict and leave the area.

choice.text: (Military Scrapper) Your scrapper taps your shoulder and requests a word.

event.text: You see what's up. "THIS STATION IS A MILITARY BASE! SERVED HERE! BELIEVE ARMS MANUFACTURING OR STORAGE! LOTS OF SCRAP! LOTS OF GUARDS!" They should at you with their typical cadance. Knowing that the outpost is indeed a military base is good to know and the appeal of raiding an arms manufactury is tempting. You ask your scrapper what they can do. "POSE AS TRANSFER! RAID THE ARMORY! RETURN! NO ONE WILL NOTICE!!!"

choice.text: You see nothing wrong with this plan at all.

event.text: You approach the outpost and are hailed shortly after turning your ship towards the outpost. You advise them that you are transporting an incoming transfer. They shout something about a requisition number. "#584154!!!" The scrapper shouts over your shoulder before you have a chance to even consider what to do. The voice from the outpost accepts the number, and your scrapper is teleported from the bridge. With the 'Transfer' complete, you return the ship to the beacon, emulating a departure.

A few minutes later you receive a communication from your scrapper indicating that they were successful in raiding the armory and are ready to be extracted. However, they will notice the teleportation, as well as you getting close enough, and also the scrapper who raided their armory is not necessarily the sneakiest. Something tells you this plan was not well thought out, but it is in motion now! You do a flyby of the outpost and beam your scrapper aboard as well as the weapon and scrap they stole. As anticipated, the outpost is now on high alert, and a fight is inevitable.

choice.text: This is a bad idea. Shoot them.

event.text: It's better to shoot first and ask questions later.

choice.text: This is a bad idea. Let's just leave.

event.text: This is a military facility, it's better to leave it be.

event.name: SCRAPPER_OUTPOST_DESTROY
event.text: The outpost has been destroyed, likely destroying any data or anything significantly valuable.

event.name: SCRAPPER_OUTPOST_DEADCREW
event.text: The outpost lies empty, you are able to strip the entire station.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SHIP_GRAVEYARD
event.text: You warp in to find a sprawling graveyard of ships, seemingly from a massive battle that took place an unknown time ago. You notice a number of unarmed scrapper ships roaming around the field picking at the scraps left behind. Not every vessel in the sector, however, is unarmed, as one such vessel approaches you and hails you.
"GREETINGS CAPTAIN!! BY RIGHT OF SALVAGE LAW THIS IS OUR BOUNTY AND ANY TRANSGRESSION WILL BE MET WITH AGRESSION!!"

choice.text: You want the salvage and propose a trade for access to the wreck. You explain the timeliness of your mission, and explain that you only wish to salvage a small portion of the wreck for the fee.

event.text: "REASONABLE HUMAN CAPTAIN! TRADE ACCEPTED! SENDING TERMS!
You transmit the resources.

choice.text: Send your crew out to Salvage the wrecked ship you were given access to.

event.text: The salvaging team reports back and advises you that there is a large amount of scrap remaining onboard but it will take additional time to get everything. They send back a fair amount of resources and await your orders.

choice.text: Let's leave before the fleet catches up to us.
Order your team to spend more time salvaging.

event.text: The fleet catches up a bit more since you decided to spend additional time salvaging, but your team returns back with an even larger amount of resources from completely breaking down the ship, and an intact weapon pulled from the hull.

choice.text: A scrapper wishes to speak with you...

event.text: One of your crew still onboard your ship advises you that something is off about this ship graveyard. "THESE SHIPS ARE UNKNOWN TO ME! DESIGNS! STRANGE! NOT TYPICAL SCRAPPER SHIPS! WE SHOULD INVESTIGATE ANOTHER HULL!!" You are not unaware that your entrance fee only bought you allowance to one ship, that you've already salvaged.

choice.text: We should take the risk and investigate investigate another hull.

event.text: You order your crew to board another ship, one of the more unknown appearing hulls. The scrapper volunteers themselves to join as they are eager to investigate it themselves. Seemingly the Scrapper guards do not notice your crew boarding another ship.

choice.text: Give your crew some time to search the ship for anything notable.

event.text: Your crew report back that they have found a previously unseen augment that can be installed on to our ship! They also found some additional resources and have been teleported back safely. However, the Scrappers have caught wind of your actions, betrayed by your decision to scrap the 2nd derelict ship a guard has detached itself from the group and has begun persuing you.

choice.text: There is no Choice but to fight now.
We better not take the risk, some mysteries are better left unsolved.
It's better to not take any chances out here. Prepare to fight.

event.text: "HOW AWFUL!"

choice.text: Ignore the Scrapper and turn to leave.

event.text: The Scrapper Salvagers' Guard seem to acknowledge your lack of interest in the wreckage, and return to patrolling the area.

choice.text: It's better to not take any chances out here. Prepare to fight.

event.text: "HOW AWFUL!"

event.name: SCRAPPER_FREE_SCRAP
event.text: There is a recently destroyed ship at this beacon. Upon closer investigation it appears that the ship recently suffered a reactor core meltdown causing the explosion that ripped the hull apart. Unfortunate for the crew that once occupied the ship, but scrap is scrap.

event.name: SCRAPPER_FREE_STUFF
event.text: You find a derelict vessel floating nearby the beacon that you are able to quickly scrap down for resources.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SOLDIER_ESCAPE_POD
event.text: You detect what appears to be a small escape pod floating by near the beacon.

choice.text: Ignore the risk, someone could use help! Beam the escape pod directly aboard and open it!

event.text: Without a second thought your crew beams the pod aboard. Your crew opens it up and a Scrapper Soldier emerges from the pod. "THANK YOU! ESCAPED FROM EXPLODING SHIP! FLOATING FOR TOO LONG TO REMEMBER! WILL SERVE! CAN I HAVE SOME SCRAP?"

choice.text: Seems too easy but let's not look a gift horse in the mouth.

event.text: You have had bad run ins before with "escape pods" enough to know this is a bad idea.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_DEALER
event.text: "COME! COME!" A small scrapper ship is at this beacon, though, no advertisement was broadcast. "ARTIFACTS OF OLD! FOR A PRICE!! GIVE US SCRAP PLEASE WE ARE DESPERATE!" You notice that the Scrapper looks a bit worse for wear from the transmission.

choice.text: View what the Scrapper has for sale.

event.text: Through the transmission you see a table with a large amount of unrecognizable equipment and 'artifacts'; this seems more like a pawn shop or a yard sale, but nontheless you feel like you should help them out? They look like they're dying.
This is a scam. Artifacts are a scam.
"WHAT DID I EVER DO TO YOU!!??"

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_CREW_SPEED
event.text:
"THANK YOU FOR YOUR PATRONAGE! I THINK WILL BE ABLE TO SURVIVE A LITTLE BIT LONGER NOW!!"
[Installed Artifact Effect: All Crew Move Speed, Repair Speed and Sabotage Speed +5%]

choice.text: Ask the Scrapper if they would like help... they seem to be in a bit of a desperate situation.

event.text: "OH! CAN YOU?!" They scream into the comm. "THIS SHIP DOESN'T WORK! ENGINES COMPLETELY BROKEN! COMRADES DEAD FOR MUCH TIME! CAN I COME ABOARD?! I AM VERY SKILLED AT SHIP OPERATIONS!!"
Welcome aboard.
"OKAY! THANK YOU!!" You may never really get used to how loud Scrappers are.
"OKAY! THANK YOU FOR YOUR SCRAP!"

choice.text: Thank the Scrapper and be on your way.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_SCOUT_DESTROY
event.text: The ship explodes, vaporizing both the destitute scrapper and whatever he was trying to sell you.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_SCOUT_DEADCREW
event.text: With the death of the artifact dealer you feel a twinge of guilt for this senseless massacre of what you now realize to be an older scrapper, just trying to stay alive. Well with that nasty bit of business out of the way you send a team over to collect whatever it was they were trying to sell you and bring it back. After a few moments they return with scrap in hand as well as what appears to be an upgrade for your lab.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ARTIFACT_STEAL_CREW_SPEED
event.text:
Your crew bring you a particularly advanced module that seems compatible with your med lab that you install immediately.

event.name: SCRAPPER_CONTAINER
event.text: You warp in to find a drifting container marked with Scrapper paint and oddly grafted metal jutting from it. It appears to be a lost shipping container.

Your rock crew successfully smashes open the container. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

Your rock crew successfully smashes open the container. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

choice.text: (Elite Scrapper Crew) Expertly salvage the container.

event.text: Your elite scrappers make quick work of the scrapper container. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

Your upgraded weapons make short work of the containers outer shielding, but it seems it was too effective, and everything inside has been completely destroyed. Well, at least its still viable metal that you can scrap, right?
It's better to not risk anything and allow the container to continue drifting through space.

No matter how much your crew tries, the containers door won't budge. Even worse, a Scrapper vessel has warped in seemingly to recover the container and notice you messing with it! They move in to attack!

Your crew manages to pry the container open. Inside appears to be a large amount of consumer goods that your crew is able to salvage for scrap, as well as what appears to be a weapon that was being smuggled. It's yours now.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_SUPPORT
event.text: A scrapper support ship is in this sector. It seems to not notice you, or it does and it does not care.

choice.text: Attack the ship before it gets any bright ideas.

event.text: Your scrapper advises you that the support ship seems to be lost. It is supposed to be with others, as part of a fleet, but this one is alone. They may need help but may find themselves unable to ask. Your scrapper tells you that it would be good to hail them, as scrappers typically only care about 1 thing and are generally not overly hostile to aliens or humans.

choice.text: Hail the scrapper support ship and offer assistance.

event.text: The Scrapper captain responds to you with a bit of a flustered tone, "HAPPY T0 S33 FL3SHY C@PTA!N WE ARE IN NEED 0F R3PA!RS!! C@N Y0U SPARE SCR@P!!???"
It seems that the scrapper does indeed only have 1 thing on its mind.

choice.text: Ask your Scrapper what they think.

event.text: Your Scrapper tells you that the Scrapper captain sounds genuine, but you can never be too sure since, of course, he's asking for Scrap. But if you are able to help someone, don't you think you should?

choice.text: Transfer the Scrapper some scrap to help facilitate their repairs.

event.text: You send over the scrap...
"THANK Y0U CAPTAIN! WE CAN OPERATE OUR ENGINES AGAIN!! TAKE FANCY MACHINE WE FIND"

choice.text: Order your crew to prepare for battle!

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_HUNTER
event.text: A scrapper vessel is in this sector. It gives you no warning before powering it's weapons. It hails you, screaming something about scrap.

event.name: SCRAPPER_ENCOUNTER_CORVETTE
event.text: A scrapper vessel is in this sector. It gives you no warning before powering it's weapons. It hails you, screaming something about scrap.

event.name: SCRAPPER_SALVAGE_GUARD_DESTROY
event.text: The guard has been destroyed. You should leave quickly before reinforcements come... Worse yet the the delay has allowed the fleet to catch up!

event.name: SCRAPPER_SALVAGE_GUARD_DEADCREW

event.name: ENCOUNTER_SCRAPPER_SUN
event.text: A Scrapper ship in the system hails you, "HOT! FIRE! HOT HOT HOT! TAMALE HOT!" Before you can parse meaning from this, it powers its weapons

event.name: ENCOUNTER_SCRAPPER_STORM
event.text: A Scrapper ship has come to this system seeking easy victims in the storm.
